children.name: to break into a lot of pieces
break into pieces
children.definition: /bits  vỡ tan tành
examples: ▪ One of the mugs rolled off the table and broke into bits on the stone floor.
▪ Investigators are not sure what caused the plane to break into pieces and plunge into the ocean.

children.name: break up
children.definition: if a large object breaks up, it breaks into a lot of pieces especially as a result of natural forces, or serious damage: vỡ tan, bể vụn
examples: The ice breaks up quicker near the shore.
Two of the missiles apparently broke up in flight.
The comet was formed when a planet broke up at some time in the distant past.

children.name: fall to pieces
children.definition: fall to bits/piecesBritishgo to piecesAmerican   to break into a lot of small pieces, especially because of beingweak,old, orbadly made:

children.name: bể vụn, vỡ vụn ( đặc biệt vì yếu,cũ, đồ dởm)
examples: ▪ The book had been read again and again, until it finally fell to pieces.

children.name: Cuốn sách đã được đọc một lần nữa cho đến khi nó cuối cùng rơi xuống
examples: ▪ I picked the bag up, and it went to pieces in my hands.

children.name: Tôi nhặt túi lên và nó rơi xuống tay tôi
examples: ▪ The trunk was full of old dresses, some of which were falling to pieces.

children.name: Thân xe tràn đầy những chiếc váy cũ, vài chiếc đã rơi thành từng mảnh
fall apart
children.definition: /come apartC2 to break easily into pieces, especially because of being badly made or very old: rách tan, nát tan
examples: ▪ I only bought these shoes last week, and they’re falling apart already.
▪ His jacket started coming apart at the seams.

children.name: shatter
children.definition: if something, especiallyglass, shatters, it breaks suddenly into a lot of very small pieces because it has beendroppedorhit:
examples: shattered[adjective only before noun]vỡ
▪ There was shattered glass all over the floor.
Có tấm kính vỡ trên sàn

children.name: vỡ tan tành ( đặc biệt kính , thủy tinh )
examples: ▪ The glass had shattered, but the photograph itself was undamaged.

children.name: Thủy tinh vỡ tan tành, nhưng bức ảnh không bị hỏng
examples: ▪ Storefront windows shattered and roofs blew off during the hurricane.

children.name: Các cửa sổ bị vỡ và mái đã thổi bay trong con bão
examples: ▪ Don’t try to drive nails into the bricks, they may shatter.
Đừng cố định vào gạch, chúng có thể bị vỡ.

children.name: smash
children.definition: tonoisilybreak into pieces as a result of beingdroppedorhit:
examples: vỡ tan tành ( với tiếng kêu mạnh )
▪ I heard something smash. What broke?
Tôi nghe thấy tiếng đập vỡ
smash to pieces/bits : vỡ tan tành
▪ The bottle rolled off the table and smashed to pieces on the floor.
Chai lăn ra khri bàn và đập vỡ thành từng mảnh trên sàn

children.name: splinter
children.definition: if something such aswoodsplinters, it breaks intothin,sharppieces:
examples: vỡ tỏe ra, vỡ lẻ chẻ ( thành nhiều miếng mỏng nhọn )
▪ These types of wood splinter more easily than redwood or cedar.
Những loại gỗ này dễ dàng hơn gỗ sồi hoặc cây tuyết tùng
▪ The coating helps prevent the glass from splintering if it is hit by a rock while you are driving.
splintered[adjective]bịvỡ tỏe ra, vỡ lẻ chẻ
Lớp sơn phủ giúp ngăn không cho thủy tinh vỡ ra nếu nó bị trúng đá khi bạn đang lái xe
▪ the splintered remains of an old fence
Nhữngmảnh vỡ của hàng rào cũ

children.name: crumble
children.definition: to break easily into a powder or into small pieces, especially as aresultof beingoldordry:
examples: vỡ vụn ( do cũ, khô )
▪ The autumn leaves crumbled in my fingers.
Lá mùa thu vỡ trên tay
▪ Some of the tiles are crumbling around the edges.
Một số gạch láy xung quanh các cạnh
crumbling[adjective]sự đỗ vỡ
▪ Nestling amongst the magnificent hills were the crumbling ruins of an old monastery.
Ngòi giữa nhwungx ngọn núi tuyệt đẹp là những tàn tích đổ nát của một tu viện cổ

children.name: disintegrate
children.definition: if something disintegrates, it breaks into a lot of small pieces so that it is completely destroyed or so that it completely changes its form: tan nát, vụn vỡ
examples: ▪ A 50-foot section of the roadway began to disintegrate after only a few cars had passed over it.
▪ The plane disintegrated in midair.
▪ The mummified man’s clothes had disintegrated almost completely, but appeared to be mainly of leather and fur.

children.name: break
children.definition: to break something, either accidentally or deliberately:

children.name: làm vỡ, làm bể ( vô tình hoặc cố tình )
examples: ▪ She fell off her bike and broke her glasses.

children.name: cô ta ngã xe đạp và vỡ kính
examples: ▪ If you break it you’ll have to pay for it out of your allowance.
Nếu bạn phá vỡ nó, bạn sẽ phải trả tiền cho nó ra khỏi khoản trợ cấp của bạn.
▪ I broke one of her platters once, and I swear she’s never forgiven me.

children.name: Tôi đã phá vỡ một trong những cái đĩa cứng của cô ấy một lần, và tôi thề cô ấy không bao giờ tha thứ cho tôi
examples: ▪ He once broke a window of his grandfather’s greenhouse with a football.

children.name: Một lần anh ấy đã phá vỡ một cửa sổ nhà kính của ông nội với một quả bóng đá
bust
children.definition: to break something:
examples: làm bể ,làm vỡ
▪ The ball hit him in the face and bust his glasses.
Bóng đánh vào mặt anh ta và đôi kính
▪ He busted the side window with a bat.
Anh ta đập vỡ cửa sowr bên trai bằng một con dơi
bust something up/bust up something : đập vỡ cái gì
▪ Dean got really drunk and started busting up the bar.
Dean đã thực sự say rượu và bắt đầu đẩy thanh
bust something down/bust down something :đập vỡ cái gì
▪ The police had to bust down the door.
Cảnh sát đã phải phá cửa

children.name: crack
children.definition: to break or damage something so that cracks appear in its surface:

children.name: làm rạn, làm nứt
examples: ▪ A stone hit the windshield and cracked it.
▪ I cracked one of the wine glasses when I was washing it.
▪ The earthquake cracked walls and driveways and knocked out electricity and communications.

children.name: to break sth into a lot of pieces
smash
children.definition: to break something into a lot of small pieces, especially in aviolentway, bydropping,throwing, orhittingit:
examples: ném vỡ, đập vỡ tan tành
▪ Firefighters smashed a bedroom window and rescued a two-year-old girl.
Lính cứu hỏa đã phá vỡ một cửa sổ phòng ngủ và giải cứu một cô gái hai tuổi
▪ Her camera was smashed by soldiers when she tried to take photographs.
Máy ảnh của cô ấy đã bị đánh tan bởi những người lính khi cô cố chụp ảnh
smash something to pieces/to bits : ném vỡ, đập vỡ cái gì tan tành
▪ The boat hit the rocks and was smashed to pieces by the waves.
Thuyền trúng đá và đập vỡ thành từng mảnh bằng sóng

children.name: shatter
children.definition: to break something, especiallyglass, into a lot of very small pieces:

children.name: làm vỡ tan , đập vỡ tan ( thường là vật bằng kính, thủy tinh )
examples: ▪ The explosion shattered office windows 500 metres away.

children.name: Vụ nổ phá vỡ văn phòng làm việc cách đó 500 mét
examples: ▪ Protesters shattered a glass door and tossed red dye around the entrance.

children.name: Những người biểu tình phá vỡ một cửa kính và ném thuốc nhuộm màu đỏ quanh lối
crumble
children.definition: to break something, especiallyfood, into very small pieces:

children.name: bẻ vụn, bóp vụn, đập vụn
examples: ▪ Beat the eggs, crumble the cheese, and mix together.

children.name: Đánh trứng, bóp vụn phô mai và trộn với nhau
examples: ▪ Mrs. Suggs crumbled the bread into hot milk.

children.name: Bà Suggs bẻ vụn bánh mì vào sữa nóng
break
children.definition: vỡ , bể
examples: ▪ She dropped a plate and it broke.

children.name: Cô ấy bỏ một cái đĩa và nó đã vỡ
examples: ▪ My watchband has broken.

children.name: Vòng đeo tay của tôi đã bị nứt
examples: ▪ The ice broke and they both fell through.

children.name: Băng tan và cả hai đều rơi
examples: ▪ The cam belt broke and ruined the engine.

children.name: Dây cam đã vỡ và làm hỏng động cơ
get broken
children.definition: if something gets broken, someone breaks it accidentally: bị vỡ
examples: ▪ If you leave your toys on the floor, they’ll get broken.

children.name: ▪ A few of the cups got broken while we were moving house
examples: ▪ When her grandchildren visit, she puts away anything she doesn’t want to get broken.

children.name: crack
children.definition: if something cracks, it breaks slightly so that lines appear in its surface: rạn nứt
examples: ▪ The bell cracked after many years of use.
▪ A few windows cracked from the heat during the fire.
▪ The pipeline had cracked a long time before the oil spill occurred.

children.name: give way
children.definition: if something such as a floor, wall, or bridge gives way, it finally breaks because there is a lot of pressure or weight on it: sập , sụp đổ ( mái nhà, tường, cầu ...)
examples: ▪ He was changing a light bulb when the ladder gave way.
▪ The crowd surged forward and the fence gave way.
▪ The whole side of the hill gave way after a week of heavy rain.

children.name: bust
children.definition: if something busts, it breaks: vỡ , bể
examples: ▪ The toy is made of a balloon in a cloth sack that can be hit without busting.

children.name: bust openbreak in such a way that what is inside can come out : vỡ tung tóe ( tung tóe những thứ bên trong )
examples: ▪ His suitcase busted open, and everything went all over the floor in the hotel lobby.

children.name: to break a piece from the main part of sth
break off
children.definition: to break off a piece of something: bẻ, tách , bấu... ( 1 phần nhỏ từ cái lớn )

children.name: break off something
examples: ▪ She broke off a bit of bread and dipped it in the soup.

children.name: break something off
examples: ▪ When the dough is chilled, break pieces of the dough off with your fingers, and roll into small balls.

children.name: break something off something
examples: ▪ Break a leaf off the bush, rub it between your fingers, and smell the lemony scent.

children.name: chip
children.definition: toaccidentallybreak off a small piece from theedgeof something, such as a cup, plate, or piece of wood:

children.name: làm sứt mẻ ( vô ý )
examples: ▪ He fell off his bike and chipped his front tooth.

children.name: Anh ta bị té xe và răng bị sứt nẻ
examples: ▪ If you don’t load the dishwasher right, it might chip some of the cups.

children.name: Nếu bạn không chạy lại máy rửa chén ngay, nó có thể làm cho một số cốc bị sứt mẻ
to break sth into two pieces
break sth in half
children.definition: break sth in two/in half to break something into two,fairlyequalpieces:

children.name: bẻ, phá vỡ làm đôi
examples: ▪ The explosion broke the ship in two.

children.name: ▪ David broke the chocolate bar in half and gave a piece to Sue
snap
children.definition: to break something, usually alongthinobject, so that it makes a sudden, short loud noise:
examples: làm gãy ( vật dài )
▪ He hit a rock and snapped the truck’s axle.
Anh ta đánh một tảng đá và đập vỡ trục xe
▪ High winds snapped power lines in the city, leaving more than 9000 people without power.
Gió mạnh đã phá vỡ đường dây điện trong thành phố, khiến hơn 9000 người không có điện
snap something in two/in half :làm gãy thành đôi
▪ He accidentally snapped his putter in half during one tournament.
Anh ấy đã vô tình đánh bật gậy của mình trong một trận trong một giải đấu
snap off : gãy
▪ The tip of the tree snapped off when it fell.
Đầu cây bị gãy khi rơi xuống

children.name: split
children.definition: to break something such aswoodinto two partsalong a straight line:
examples: bửa , tách , chẻ ( làm đôi 1 đường thẳng dài )
▪ She learned to split logs and stack a woodpile.
Cô ấy học cách chia gỗ tròn và xếp chồng lên nhau
split something in two/in half : bửa , tách , chẻ cái gì làm đôi
▪ Split the leek in half lengthwise, and cut it into 1/4-inch pieces.
Chia ra theo chiều dọc một nửa và cắt nó thành 1 /4- inch

children.name: to break and becomes separated from the main part
break off
children.definition: if a part of something breaks off, it breaks and becomes separated from the main part of it: lìa ra, rời ra, long ra
examples: ▪ I gave it a tug and the zipper broke off.
▪ A military cargo plane made an emergency landing when one of the propellers broke off.
▪ Icebergs break off from the ice sheets and float southwards.

children.name: come off U
children.definition: come off if part of something comes off it becomes separated from the main part of it because it is not fastened to it firmly enough: long ra, rơi ra , rớt ra ( do không chắc chắn )
examples: ▪ Can you fix the door? The handle’s come off.

children.name: come off sth
examples: ▪ A wheel had come off a car, and rolled to the side of the road.

children.name: come away
children.definition: to easily become separated from a surface when touched, pulled etc: rời ra, bung ra ( từ một mặt phẳng )
examples: ▪ The switch was attached to the plate and came away with it when I pulled.

children.name: come away from
examples: ▪ Mix until the dough comes away from the side of the bowl.

children.name: come away in sb’ handbecome separated very easily or without you realising it rời/rớt/bung ra khỏi một cách dễ dàng
examples: ▪ Ralph pulled, and the lock came away in his hand.

children.name: break sth in half
children.definition: break in two/in half vỡ, bể làm đôi
examples: ▪ The ship broke in two when it ran aground, and 900 tons of fuel oil leaked out.
▪ When I pulled at the board, it broke in two and fell down.

children.name: snap
children.definition: if something snaps, especially something long and thin, it breaks into two pieces making a short loud noise: gãy ( vật dài )
examples: ▪ A twig snapped under his foot.
▪ Power lines snapped in the high winds.
▪ One of the strings on my guitar snapped when I was tuning it.

children.name: snap off
examples: ▪ The tip of the Christmas tree snapped off when it fell.

children.name: split
children.definition: ifwood,boneetcsplits, it breaks into two parts along astraightline:
examples: bửa , tách , chẻ
▪ The window frames are old and the wood is starting to split.
Khung cửa sổ cũ và gỗ bắt đầu phân chia
▪ When it crashed, the plane’s fuselage split behind the wings.
Khi rơi, thân máy bay chia đôi cánh
split in two/half: bửa , tách , chẻ làm đôi
▪ The back of the chair had split in two.split open split so that there is a hole
Phía sau ghế đã tách hai phần mở rộng để có một cái lỗ
▪ A metal tube split open in the steam generator of the nuclear power plant.
Một ống kim loại được tách ra trong máy phát điện hơi nước của nhà máy điện hạt nhân

children.name: to break a bone in your body
break
children.definition: làm gãy , vỡ
examples: I broke my leg last time I went skiing.
She slipped on the floor, it’d just been washed, and broke her hip.
They thought he’d broken his back, but the X-ray showed it was okay.

children.name: crack
children.definition: topartlybreak a bone:
examples: làm rạn nứt ( 1 phần xương )
▪ She slipped and cracked a rib.
Cô ta trượt và làm gãy một đốt sườn
▪ Freeman cracked his skull in the accident.
Freeman đập vỡ hộp sọ trong tai nạn
crack[countable noun]vết rạn nứt
▪ The X-ray showed several cracks in the bone of her left leg.
X-quang cho thấy một số vết nứt trong xương chântrái

children.name: fracture
children.definition: to break or partly break a bone in your body- used especiallybydoctors:
examples: làm gãy ( dùng đặc biệt trong y học )
▪ My grandmother fell down the stairs and fractured her ankle.
Bà tôi ngã xuống cầu thang và gãy cổ chân.
▪ He fractured both his legs in the car accident.
Ông ấy gãy cả hai chân trong tai nạn xe hơi
fracture[countable noun]chỗgãy xương
▪ More elderly women than men suffer hip fractures.
Nhiều phụ nữ cao tuổi hơn nam giưới bị gãy xương hông
fractured[adjective only before noun]bị gãy
▪ He had a fractured skull.Ông ta có một cái đầu gãy

children.name: shatter
children.definition: to break a bone in someone’s body intoa lotof small pieces, especially byshootingorhittingthem:

children.name: đánh , tông ... gãy ( xương ai )
examples: ▪ The nine-year-old boy was hit by a car and shattered his skull on the pavement.
cậu bé 9 tuổi đã bị đánh trúng một chiếc xe hơi và làm vỡ hộp sọ trên vỉa hè.
▪ The bullet shattered a bone in her left forearm.

children.name: Viên đạn đã phá vỡ một xương trong cánh tay trái
bust
children.definition: especially American,informalto break one of the bones in your body:

children.name: làm vỡ, làm bể ( xương )
examples: ▪ She fell and busted her knee.

children.name: Cô ấy ngã và đập đầu vào gối
apart
children.definition: adverbSEPARATE

children.name: into smaller pieces
examples: _My jacket is so old it'sfallingapart.
_Itookthe motor apart (= separated it into pieces) to see how it worked.

children.name: break
children.definition: nounDAMAGE

children.name: catch
children.definition: verbcaught,caughtSTICK
